text: The Anderson Boarding House is a historic boarding house at 201 North Main Street in Clarendon, Arkansas. == Description and history == Built in 1921, it is one of the city's finest examples of Craftsman architecture, with a projecting front porch, and exposed rafter ends. It is the only known building in the city that was purpose-built as a boarding house, with a first floor layout that has three rooms on each side of a narrow hall, and a dining hall at the rear. The house was listed on the National Register of Historic Places on November 1, 1984. It may have been demolished. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Monroe County, Arkansas ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Arkansas Category:Houses completed in 1921 Category:Houses in Monroe County, Arkansas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Monroe County, Arkansas
title: Anderson Boarding House
